FactText.S: AWS S3 was one of the very first AWS services, launched in 2006.
Netflix runs almost all of its infrastructure on AWS.
Cloud computing can save companies up to 30% on IT costs.
NASA uses AWS to store and share Mars mission data with the public.
AWS has more than 200 fully featured services today.
The 'cloud' doesn't float in the sky, it's made of giant data centers on Earth.
More than 90% of Fortune 100 companies use AWS.
AWS data centers are so secure that they require retina scans and 24/7 guards.
Serverless doesn't mean there are no servers, it just means you don't manage them.
Each AWS Availability Zone has at least one independent power source and cooling system.
Amazon once accidentally took down parts of the internet when S3 had an outage in 2017.
The fastest-growing AWS service is Amazon SageMaker, used for Machine Learning.
The word 'cloud' became popular in the 1990s as a metaphor for the internet.
AWS Lambda can automatically scale from zero to thousands of requests per second.
More data is stored in the cloud today than in all personal computers combined.
